name: cnrlvec

body.origin:
|- wcel(c0, clvec)
-| wceq(c0, cfv(crglmod, ccnfld))
-| wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), clvec)
body.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈ LVec
⊣ c0 =(ringLMod ` CCfld)
⊣ (ringLMod ` CCfld)∈ LVec

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(c0, clvec)
-| wceq(c0, cfv(crglmod, ccnfld))
-| wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), clvec)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈ LVec
⊣ c0 =(ringLMod ` CCfld)
⊣ (ringLMod ` CCfld)∈ LVec

body.origin:
|- wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), clvec)
-| wcel(ccnfld, cdr)
-| wi(wcel(ccnfld, cdr), wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), clvec))
body.pretty:
⊢ (ringLMod ` CCfld)∈ LVec
⊣ CCfld ∈ DivRing
⊣ (CCfld ∈ DivRing →(ringLMod ` CCfld)∈ LVec)

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(c0, clvec)
-| wceq(c0, cfv(crglmod, ccnfld))
-| wcel(ccnfld, cdr)
-| wi(wcel(ccnfld, cdr), wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), clvec))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈ LVec
⊣ c0 =(ringLMod ` CCfld)
⊣ CCfld ∈ DivRing
⊣ (CCfld ∈ DivRing →(ringLMod ` CCfld)∈ LVec)

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(c0, clvec)
-| wceq(c0, cfv(crglmod, ccnfld))
-| wi(wcel(ccnfld, cdr), wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), clvec))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈ LVec
⊣ c0 =(ringLMod ` CCfld)
⊣ (CCfld ∈ DivRing →(ringLMod ` CCfld)∈ LVec)

comment: The complex left module of complex numbers is a left vector space. The vector operation is ` + ` , and the scalar product is ` x. ` . (Contributed by AV, 21-Sep-2021.)
